intro: Lunathyrium kanghsienense, commonly known as the Kanghsien bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
